heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: There was a torrential downpour today where the rain reached a maximum intensity of 16.6mm per hour (ranked 2nd in our records).  The storm lasted 3.2 hours and 5.69mm of precipitation fell during that time.  The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 4th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 10 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is not a heatwave right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (196°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.2°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 10%) and rainfall (down 1.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 1.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm), feels like temperature (up 2.2°C), outside temperature (up 1.6°C), and cloud levels (up 714 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 786.5m higher than yesterday, 340.4m higher than the past week, 714.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 565m to 1838m and averaged 1897.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, air moisture should feel ok and calm and still conditions are expected. Rain showers likely, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and very bright daylight. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
